I'm the one who cleans it on the 610 loop and every highway inside of it besides 45 288. I also would like to meet Rookie and Mezo so I can personally thank them for this great job security. I was on the overpass at I-10 and right before Washington where the train runs by trying to figure out how they got there. I eventually figured it out and was not willing to go to such lengths to get what they did. So tonight I will have a bucket truck with me so I can hit it from the highway. And thank you Sergio for the Badass flash light you left behind. You shouldn't etch your name in things if your going to leave it behind for me. But your secret is safe with me. I have ultimate job security.

I pay for 75mbps and after they did a service upgrade in my area I get 115mbps. It's really great. Sorry not trying to rub it in.
Edit: That used to happen to me until I called and requested a new modem/router. After I got it I went up to 82mbps. I highly suggest you do this. Good luck

Unfortunately I don't. I've never used one. I was just looking for something my co-workers could transition with containing higher nic levels to kick them off tobacco. And it worked just fine for them. They are now down to 6mg and with new mods/tanks. But for someone who is already down to 6mg I wouldn't have the slightest clue on which you should use. Sorry buddy.
You shall live to see another day.
If you drink it. But a little spit back here and there won't kill you. Unless it's 1000mg pure nicotine. Then you'll have a problem.
[Read this thread ](https://www.reddit.com/r/Vaping/comments/5gf11j/i_want_to_switch_to_vaping_after_dipping_for/?st=iwaps65t sh=0d753dca)
Happens often. You'll know by the taste and tingle.
True. But I was trying to tackle the problem at hand first. Then once you stop dipping/smoking then enjoy the hobby side of it. Just my opinion.

Here is my simple suggestion that I've seen work with 3 co-workers. 1 dipped the others smoked.
First buy [this](http://www.efun.top/eleaf-icare-starter-kit-650mah.html) its cheap and if for some reason it does not work out you won't be mad at yourself for spending $120
Second make sure you get [this liquid ](https://gaslightvapor.com/collections/e-liquids/mr-salt-e-liquids)
People are going to recommend you buy all kinds of nice things. But IMHO start with this to get you off then start enjoying the hobby side of it.
Good luck!!
Edit: That liquid is important. It's nicotine salts. Just do some research on it.

That is absolutely understood. But what's running to tell HFD going to do? That's why I said talk to the owner. Voice your concern with he/she and go on about your business. There is much bigger things to be worried about then a oven burning off debris. Now if OP got sick or seriously hurt then I can see why they would want to tell HFD but obviously they are fine.

Ok so fill me in. What are you really mad about? And it's that serious you need to go tell the HFD? All that's going to accomplish is wasting everyone's time. 1) HFD will probably laugh at you. 2) If it's that important talk to the owner. 3) Just get over it and on with your life. I'm sure you have way more important things then this. Happy Holidays

610 north runs from 290 to 90 610 east runs from 90 to 225 610 south runs from 225 to S. Post Oak 610 west runs from S. Post Oak to 290
On 610 east and west traffic flows north and south On 610 south and north traffic flows east and west
Interesting fact: The loop is 38 miles around
I only say this because I work for TxDOT and the loop is part of my area. It's really not a big deal. A lot of people get confused. Just figured you would like to report correct info.
610 west going northbound? 610 north and Westheimer do not intersect with each other.
Great job. Excited to see what's next
It's on the first Saturday of every month.

Just did some research on a irrevocable trust and seems like a great option.
I bank at Wells Fargo but I also have a local credit union that I'm using as well. I plan on taking the CD route after I have enough money saved for him and pray the rates get better.

Wow. Thanks for the great insight. Seems like 529 is garbage. Great idea to get a CD with the saved money and continuing to put money in savings. I'm taking a page out of your playbook.
Edit: Barclays financial has a great kids saving offer. It's called a dream account. 1.05%apr with two bonus options if you qualify for 2.5% each. Essentially a 5% bonus.

That's exactly what I'm looking for. Thank you so much. Do you have any recommendations on where to get CD's also can you set a term for 17 years or is it better to roll them every so often. Again thank you.

From what I've read it allows you to withdraw money for school and school related things. Which isn't terrible by any means. But I would like for him to have the option of getting money for school and other things he might need i.e car

WRITING.TITLE: Need advice on savings for a newborn
WRITING.TEXT: Hello everyone. I have a son that's 8 months old and would like to start saving for him and his future. I'm really on here to get some insider tips on what to do and what to avoid. Google can only tell you so much. My idea was to open an account and let it withdrawal set amount every Friday but still have the option to where grandparents can deposit money as well. I don't want anybody to be able to touch it besides him and when he at least turns 18. I would like it to generate some kind on interest as well. I read a little about a 529 plan but I would like to know other options. Thank you for your time.
I-45s going northbound?

Apply for TXDOT. It's a state job but they are always looking for engineers. Great benefits and if you are good at managing money you won't mind getting paid once a month. But if you are not good at watching/spending money this could be a downfall. Good luck in your future endeavors.
